suncertify.db
Class Data

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.Data
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataRow, DBMain, MetaData, java.io.Serializable
public class Data
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBMain, DataRow

This is the actual data access class. All database activity implementation lives here. It is an implementation of the DBMain interface and implements all methods defined there. This class can be accessed only with a VMID which is used for lock tracking and maintenence. This uses the RandomAccessFile to seek, create, read, update and delete data.

Version:
1.6
Author:
Rohit Sood
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Data

public Data(java.rmi.dgc.VMID vmid)
Creates a new Data object. This can be constructed only with a VMID. A new instance is created for a unique client. This is used for locked records.

Parameters:
vmid - The unique client id.
Method Detail

clearLocks

public void clearLocks()
Clears all locks for the client with the current VMID This is called when the client no longer needs database access.

getFile

private java.io.RandomAccessFile getFile(java.lang.String mode)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Retrieves the database file in a given mode. All modes of the RandomAccessFile are supported.

Parameters:
mode - The mode in which the files
Returns:
The RandomAccessFile instance.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there was a problem obtaining the file.

findFirstDeletedRecord

private int findFirstDeletedRecord()
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   RecordNotFoundException
Retrives the first deleted record. Searches for the lowest record id available. If a record has been logically deleted it returns its record id, and consequent data is overwritten. If a record is locked it will not make it available even though a deletion is detected for it.

Returns:
The next available record id.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is problem reading the database file.
RecordNotFoundException - If no reusable record ids were found.

newRecordID

private int newRecordID()
                 throws java.io.IOException
Selects the next available record id which is currently deleted. If no logically deleted records are available for reuse then the max record id is incremented by one. The newly created record id locked.

Returns:
The new record id.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading from the local database file.

getTotalRecords

private int getTotalRecords()
                     throws java.io.IOException
This counts the records - but does not ignore the deleted ones.

Returns:
The total number of records currently including logically deleted records.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is a problem reading from the database file.

read

private java.lang.String[] read(int recNo,
                                boolean readDeletedRecord)
                         throws RecordNotFoundException
Reads records from the underlying database file system. A provision is made to read even deleted records. This can be leveraged for admin functions for an undelete functionality.

Parameters:
recNo - The record number to read.
readDeletedRecord - Flag indicating if deleted records should be read.
Returns:
The array of strings that represent that data.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If the record was not found.

Parameters:
recNo - The id of the record to locate.
Returns:
The file pointer position of the record.

isDeleted

private boolean isDeleted(int recNo)
                   throws RecordNotFoundException
Checks to see if the record id is deleted. Locks the record before you call this method so that the value returned is not dirty.

Parameters:
recNo - The record id to check for deleted flag.
Returns:
true if deleted, false otherwise.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If the record is not found.

find

public int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
           throws RecordNotFoundException
If criteria[n] is null it is considered to be a match Also, if criteria[n] is an empty string it is considered to be a match Record element 'n' must atleast begin with criteria[n] to be a match Searches are case-sensitive.

Specified by:
find in interface DBMain
Parameters:
criteria - The criteria to search against.
Returns:
Array of record numbers which matched the criteria.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If no records are returned for the criteria.

parseList

private int[] parseList(java.util.List list)
Given a list of data records parses the list and retireves the record id.

Parameters:
list - The list of data records.
Returns:
The array of record ids.

isMatch

private boolean isMatch(java.lang.String[] criteria,
                        java.lang.String[] record)
Matches a record based on criteria. A match is all records if all the strings are marked as null or empty. If a criteria field is not null then a match is determined. If none of the criteria are given then match everything If atleast one of the criteria is given then filter based on that Each criteria is a logical AND rather than an OR This is because an OR adds no value to the search

Parameters:
criteria - The criteria to match.
record - The record to match against.
Returns:
true if it is a match, false otherwise.

isEmptyOrNullCriteria

private boolean isEmptyOrNullCriteria(java.lang.String[] c)
Checks if the criteria object is null or all fields in it are empty or null.

Parameters:
c - The criteria array.
Returns:
true if the criteria is empty, null or has only empty or null items, false otherwise.

create

public int create(java.lang.String[] record)
           throws DuplicateKeyException
Create will first search any available recordID which is deleted If a deleted record is found - the new record will be written there If no deleted record is found in the database - then the new record will be written at the end of the file

Specified by:
create in interface DBMain
Parameters:
record - The record to be created.
Returns:
int The record id of the newly created record.
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - If the same id already exists.

                  int recNo,
                  int dataColumn)
           throws java.io.IOException
Seeks the position in the given file such that the file pointer moves to the data column of the record id.

Parameters:
file - The file within which to move the pointer.
recNo - The record id to which the pointer should be moved.
dataColumn - The column before which the pointer should rest.
Returns:
The seeked position in the file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is a problem accessing the file.

scrubRecord

private java.lang.String[] scrubRecord(java.lang.String[] record)
The data record is scrubbed before being saved. The scrubbing includes fixing the lengths of data to match the schema.

Parameters:
record - The record to scrub.
Returns:
The scrubbed data record.

lock

public void lock(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. If the specified record is already locked, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Specified by:
lock in interface DBMain
Parameters:
recNo - The record number of the record to lock.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If the record could not be found.
